info.name: Dorsal column nuclei
info.description: The dorsal column nuclei are AKA the posterior column nuclei. Included are the gracile and cuneate nuclei which contain the second-order neurons that receive tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive input from the body. The axons of these dorsal column nuclei neurons decussate in the medulla to form the medial lemniscus which will travel to and synapse in the ventral posterior lateral nucleus of the thalamus.
